title: Gaza: New accounts of the 'flour massacre'
summary: On February 29, 118 Palestinians were killed and 760 injured while waiting for a humanitarian aid convoy, according to the local Ministry of Health. Survivors tell Le Monde they were the target of Israeli fire.

title: Macron's allies blast far right at European election campaign launch
summary: 'They have always said no to Europe,' said Prime Minister Gabriel Attal, at a campaign event in Lille.

title: Netanyahu 'hurting Israel more than helping,' according to Biden
summary: In a TV interview on Saturday, the American President pointed out an Israeli ground attack on Rafah "is a red line (...) but I'm never going to leave Israel."

title: The DMA comes into force in the EU, with Apple already strongly contested
summary: Digital industry players are already denouncing the lack of compliance with the European regulation, which came into effect on March 7 and aims to subject industry giants to competition rules.

title: MMA's Benoît Saint Denis: Former para in the octagon on Saturdays, churchgoer on Sundays
summary: The French fighter is taking on the American Dustin Poirier, one of the stars of MMA, in Miami, Florida. Success would give him a chance to fight for the lightweight belt.

title: Six Nations: England ends Ireland's Grand Slam bid with late drop goal
summary: Marcus Smith's last-ditch drop-goal clinched a 23-22 win for England.

title: Lebanon: Israeli airstrike kills five people, including three Hezbollah members
summary: Since the start of the Israel-Hamas war in October at least 312 people, mainly Hezbollah fighters, and 56 civilians have been killed in Lebanon. The fighting is mainly along border regions but fears have grown of a broader conflict in Lebanon.

title: Leader of Marseille's 'Yoda' drug gang arrested in Morocco
summary: Félix Bingui, the leader one of the two main gangs in the southern French city, was arrested in Casablanca, French authorities said.

title: Irish constitutional referendum on family and women's roles defeated, concedes PM
summary: Taoiseach Leo Varadkar said the two proposals to modernize language in the 1937 Constitution about the definition of family and a mother's 'duties in the home.'

title: 'The Regime': Kate Winslet plays paranoid autocrat in dystopia created by 'Succession' alumnus
summary: In Will Tracy's bold but overly complex political fiction, the brilliant British actress takes on the role of a neurotic, unpopular chancellor.

title: Paris 2024 Olympics: Government to pay civil servants bonuses to avoid strikes
summary: Public Administration Minister Stanislas Guerini said eligible workers will get a bonus ranging from €500 to €1,500, two days after a major union said it would file strike notices covering the duration of the Games.

title: UK's David Cameron opposes sending troops to Ukraine, even for training
summary: Cameron said training missions are best carried out abroad, as British troops have done so far.

title: Six Nations: Italy celebrates rare win after stunning Scotland
summary: Italy won its first Six Nations hole match in 11 years, offering Ireland the chance to claim the title later on Saturday.

title: Expanding Israeli settlements a 'war crime', according to the UN
summary: France's foreign ministry also said it 'strongly condemns' the settlement plan and called on the Israeli government to 'immediately reverse this decision' to build another 3,476 settler homes in the West Bank colonies.

title: The best places to stay, eat, drink and see in Nice
summary: To visit the city on the French Riviera without getting lost or stumbling into tourist traps, Le Monde journalists selected 20 top addresses.

title: In Mexico, Carlos Slim shows press he's still got it
summary: The Mexican tycoon spoke to journalists in Mexico City for the first time in five years. The billionaire fought back against the accusations made by Oxfam.

title: After Istanbul visit, Zelensky is counting on Turkey's support
summary: On March 8, the Ukrainian president met with his Turkish counterpart, Recep Tayyip Erdogan, who is once again trying to mediate between Kyiv and Moscow.

title: European elections: Macron's coalition looks to frame race as duel with far right
summary: Emmanuel Macron's Renaissance party and its allies are holding a rally in Lille to launch their campaign, which will be led by MEP Valérie Hayer. They are focusing their attacks Marine Le Pen's eurosceptic Rassemblement National party.
